Previous: pāyNext: pinv

√pi 'swell, fatten'

present: [1.] páyate   -- píyāna   -- pīpihí  pipyatam etc.  pīpáyat etc.  pīpaya  ápīpet etc.  ápīpayat  ápīpema  ápīpyan  pīpáyanta  pī́pyāna   -- [5.] pinvánt  pinvatī́  pinvire  pinvāná  pinvāte  apinvātām  

perfect: pīpā́ya etc.  pīpetha  pipyathus  pipyus  pipye?  pīpyāná  

verbal: pīná AV.+  

derivatives: -paya?  páyas V.+  -pyasa? AV.  -pit RV.  pitú V.B.  pīyū́ṣa V.+  pī́va AB.  pī́van V.+  pīvāṅs M.  pīvara E.+  pī́vas V.B.  pī́viṣṭha ÇB.  

The roots pinv and pyā (given for convenience separately) are extensions of this. The classification of the reduplicated forms is difficult and questionable.
